title: Senior Research Radiographer
text:
Faculty / Organisational unit : Medical & Human Sciences School / Directorate : Institute of Population Health Division : Centre for Imaging Sciences Employment type : Permanent Salary : £30,434 - £37,394 per annum Hours per week : Full time 
The University of Manchester Magnetic Resonance Imaging Facility has three research dedicated MRI scanners located across the city of Manchester. There are currently two Philips 3.0 tesla and one Philips 1.5 tesla scanners with a proposed PET/MR scanner to be installed within the next twelve months. PET scanning will be covered by dedicated PET imagers. 
The main body of work is neuro, cancer, cardiac and musculo-skeletal research imaging. You must have significant MRI experience and be prepared to work across these centres. A good knowledge of MRI sequences and applications and how to adapt them is a desirable quality and good computer skills essential. There is some clinical commitment but the main emphasis is research scanning. 
The Institute of Population Health is committed to promoting equality and diversity, including the Athena SWAN charter for promoting women’s careers in STEMM subjects (science, technology, engineering, mathematics and medicine) in higher education. The Institute received a Bronze Award in 2013 for their commitment to the representation of women in the workplace and we particularly welcome applications from women for this post. Appointment will always be made on merit. For further information, please visit http://www.mhs.manchester.ac.uk/about-us/athena/ . 
Enquiries about the vacancy, shortlisting and interviews: 
Barry Whitnall, Lead Research Radiographer
